person.persName: John Alexander Logan (Illinois politician and soldier.)

body.p: Illinois politician and soldier. Illinois native. Son of John Logan and Elizabeth Jenkins Logan. Married to Mary Simmerson Cunningham Logan on November 27, 1855. Father of Mary E. Logan and John A. Logan, Jr. Attended Shiloh College in Randolph County, Illinois, from 1842-1845. Served in the First Illinois Volunteer Infantry as a second lieutenant in the Mexican-American War from June 8, 1847, to October 18, 1848. Attorney in Jackson County, Illinois, in 1850. Graduated from the University of Louisville Law School in Louisville, Kentucky, in February 1851. Member of the Illinois House of Representatives in 1843. Member of the U.S. House of Representatives from 1859 to 1861. Attorney in Benton, Franklin County, Illinois, in 1860. Served in the 31st Illinois Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as colonel from September 18, 1861, to March 21, 1862. Promoted to Brigadier General of Volunteers on March 21, 1862. Promoted to Major General of Volunteers on March 13, 1863 to date from November 29, 1862. Commanded the XV Corps of the Union Army. Resigned on August 17, 1865.
